intro: Nemcia luteifolia, commonly known as the yellow-leaved nemcia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated as an ornamental plant in botanical gardens.
